thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: McGee's lawyer: Lyle leak inappropriate

author: courier-journal.com
title: McGee's lawyer: Lyle leak inappropriate
text:
After a report Thursday that Ohio State freshman JaQuan Lyle confirmed "the gist of allegations" against the University of Louisville basketball program, the lawyer for the former U of L staffer said it would be difficult to respond to "an inappropriate leak from an anonymous source."
Scott C. Cox, a Louisville attorney representing U of L's ex-director of basketball operations Andre McGee, said he would let the criminal and NCAA investigations run their course without commenting on Lyle's reported corroboration of at least part of escort Katina Powell's claims in her book, "Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen."
Powell claims McGee paid her and other escorts, including three of her teenage daughters, thousands of dollars and gave them game tickets in exchange for sex with U of L players and recruits.
"It's difficult to respond to an inappropriate leak from an anonymous source about what was allegedly said in a confidential interview," Cox wrote in an email to The Courier-Journal.
"What does the 'gist' even mean? This is a serious criminal and NCAA investigation. We're going to let it run its course without commenting on every rumor."
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Ex-U of L hoops staffer's lawyer slams book
On Friday, Cox said McGee denied the allegations in Powell's book. McGee "loves the University of Louisville and would not do anything to hurt the image of the university," Cox said.
Cox sent a short statement to The Courier-Journal earlier this week after the Indianapolis Business Journal's news publication posted an interview with Powell, who said U of L head coach Rick Pitino knew about McGee's alleged interactions with her.
"Coach Pitino and his staff were not involved in this in any respect," Cox said.
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Andre McGee's lawyer: Pitino not involved
